pullRequest.title: Chore: Added a table for Kubectl to Fabric8 Kubernetes Java Client mappings
pullRequest.bodyText:
I was maintaining this table at my demo repository: https://github.com/rohanKanojia/kubernetes-client-demo . I think it's more suited for fabric8 to give users a guide on how to use the client from a kubectl perspective. I've tried to provide equivalents of most of the commands listed here:
https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/cheatsheet/
Description

Type of change


 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 Feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change
 Chore (non-breaking change which doesn't affect codebase;
test, version modification, documentation, etc.)

Checklist

 Code contributed by me aligns with current project license: Apache 2.0
 I Added CHANGELOG entry regarding this change
 I have implemented unit tests to cover my changes
 I have added/updated the javadocs and other documentation accordingly
 No new bugs, code smells, etc. in SonarCloud report
 I tested my code in Kubernetes
 I tested my code in OpenShift

nodes.bodyText: Shouldn't these be picked up from the parent pom??
I recall we exposed the applicable config, what's missing so that we don't have to deserialize the config file again?
